Q1.question_text: Family: How important is it in your life?

Q2.question_text: Friends: How important is it in your life?

Q3.question_text: Leisure time: How important is it in your life?

Q4.question_text: Politics: How important is it in your life?

Q5.question_text: Work: How important is it in your life?

Q6.question_text: Religion: How important is it in your life?

Q7.question_text: Good manners: Do you consider it an important quality for children to learn?

Q8.question_text: Independence: Do you consider it an important quality for children to learn?

Q9.question_text: Hard work: Do you consider it an important quality for children to learn?

Q10.question_text: Feeling of responsibility: Do you consider it an important quality for children to learn?

Q11.question_text: Imagination: Do you consider it an important quality for children to learn?

Q12.question_text: Tolerance and respect for other people: Do you consider it an important quality for children to learn?

Q13.question_text: Thrift, saving money and things: Do you consider it an important quality for children to learn?

Q14.question_text: Determination, perseverance: Do you consider it an important quality for children to learn?

Q15.question_text: Religious faith: Do you consider it an important quality for children to learn?

Q16.question_text: Not being selfish (unselfishness): Do you consider it an important quality for children to learn?

Q17.question_text: Obedience: Do you consider it an important quality for children to learn?

Q18.question_text: Would you not like to have drug addicts as neighbors?

Q19.question_text: Would you not like to have people of a different race as neighbors?

Q20.question_text: Would you not like to have people who have AIDS as neighbors?

Q21.question_text: Would you not like to have immigrants/foreign workers as neighbors?

Q22.question_text: Would you not like to have homosexuals as neighbors?

Q23.question_text: Would you not like to have people of a different religion as neighbors?

Q24.question_text: Would you not like to have heavy drinkers as neighbors?

Q25.question_text: Would you not like to have unmarried couples living together as neighbors?

Q26.question_text: Would you not like to have people who speak a different language as neighbors?

Q27.question_text: One of my main goals in life has been to make my parents proud.

Q28.question_text: When a mother works for pay, the children suffer.

Q29.question_text: On the whole, men make better political leaders than women do.

Q30.question_text: A university education is more important for a boy than for a girl.

Q31.question_text: On the whole, men make better business executives than women do.

Q32.question_text: Being a housewife is just as fulfilling as working for pay.

Q33.question_text: When jobs are scarce, men should have more right to a job than women.

Q34.question_text: When jobs are scarce, employers should give priority to people of this country over immigrants.

Q35.question_text: If a woman earns more money than her husband, it's almost certain to cause problems.

Q36.question_text: Homosexual couples are as good parents as other couples.

Q37.question_text: It is a duty towards society to have children.

Q38.question_text: Adult children have the duty to provide long-term care for their parents.

Q39.question_text: People who don’t work turn lazy.

Q40.question_text: Work is a duty towards society.

Q41.question_text: Work should always come first, even if it means less spare time.

Q42.question_text: Which of the following best describes your opinion about society?

options.1: The entire way our society is organized must be radically changed by revolutionary action.
options.2: Our society must be gradually improved by reforms.
options.3: Our present society must be valiantly defended against all subversive forces.

Q43.question_text: Would it be a good thing, bad thing, or don't you mind if there was less importance placed on work in our lives?

Q44.question_text: Would it be a good thing, bad thing, or don't you mind if there was more emphasis on the development of technology?

Q45.question_text: Would it be a good thing, bad thing, or don't you mind if there was greater respect for authority?

Q46.question_text: Taking all things together, would you say you are:

Q47.question_text: All in all, how would you describe your state of health these days?

Q48.question_text: How much freedom of choice and control do you feel you have over the way your life turns out?

Q49.question_text: All things considered, how satisfied are you with your life as a whole these days?

Q50.question_text: How satisfied are you with the financial situation of your household?

Q51.question_text: In the last 12 months, how often have you or your family gone without enough food to eat?

Q52.question_text: In the last 12 months, how often have you or your family felt unsafe from crime in your home?

Q53.question_text: In the last 12 months, how often have you or your family gone without medicine or medical treatment that you needed?

Q54.question_text: In the last 12 months, how often have you or your family gone without a cash income?

Q55.question_text: In the last 12 months, how often have you or your family gone without a safe shelter over your head?

Q56.question_text: Comparing your standard of living with your parents' when they were about your age, would you say that you are:

Q57.question_text: Generally speaking, would you say that most people can be trusted or that you need to be very careful in dealing with people?

Q58.question_text: How much do you trust your family?

Q59.question_text: How much do you trust your neighborhood?

Q60.question_text: How much do you trust people you know personally?

Q61.question_text: How much do you trust people you meet for the first time?

Q62.question_text: How much do you trust people of another religion?

Q63.question_text: How much do you trust people of another nationality?

Q64.question_text: How much confidence do you have in the churches?

Q65.question_text: How much confidence do you have in the armed forces?

Q66.question_text: How much confidence do you have in the press?

Q67.question_text: How much confidence do you have in television?

Q68.question_text: How much confidence do you have in labor unions?

Q69.question_text: How much confidence do you have in the police?

Q70.question_text: How much confidence do you have in the courts?

Q71.question_text: How much confidence do you have in the government?

Q72.question_text: How much confidence do you have in political parties?

Q73.question_text: How much confidence do you have in parliament?

Q74.question_text: How much confidence do you have in the civil service?

Q75.question_text: How much confidence do you have in universities?

Q76.question_text: How much confidence do you have in elections?

Q77.question_text: How much confidence do you have in major companies?

Q78.question_text: How much confidence do you have in banks?

Q79.question_text: How much confidence do you have in environmental organizations?

Q80.question_text: How much confidence do you have in women's organizations?

Q81.question_text: How much confidence do you have in charitable or humanitarian organizations?

Q82.question_text: How much confidence do you have in the European Union (or relevant regional organization)?

Q83.question_text: How much confidence do you have in the United Nations?

Q84.question_text: How much confidence do you have in the International Monetary Fund (IMF)?

Q85.question_text: How much confidence do you have in the International Criminal Court (ICC)?

Q86.question_text: How much confidence do you have in the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO)?

Q87.question_text: How much confidence do you have in the World Bank?

Q88.question_text: How much confidence do you have in the World Health Organization (WHO)?

Q89.question_text: How much confidence do you have in the World Trade Organization (WTO)?

Q90.question_text: Should international organizations prioritize being effective or being democratic?

Q91.question_text: Which one of the following is NOT a member of the United Nations Security Council?

Q92.question_text: Where are the headquarters of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) located?

Q93.question_text: Which of the following problems does Amnesty International deal with?

Q94.question_text: Are you an active member, an inactive member, or not a member of a church or religious organization?

Q95.question_text: Are you an active member, an inactive member, or not a member of a labor union?

Q96.question_text: Are you an active member, an inactive member, or not a member of a political party?

Q97.question_text: Are you an active member, an inactive member, or not a member of an environmental organization?

Q98.question_text: Are you an active member, an inactive member, or not a member of a sport or recreational organization?

Q99.question_text: Are you an active member, an inactive member, or not a member of an art, music, or educational organization?

Q100.question_text: Are you an active member, an inactive member, or not a member of a professional association?

Q102.question_text: Are you an active member, an inactive member, or not a member of a consumer organization?

Q103.question_text: Are you an active member, an inactive member, or not a member of a self-help group or mutual aid group?

Q104.question_text: Are you an active member, an inactive member, or not a member of a women’s group?

Q105.question_text: Are you an active member, an inactive member, or not a member of any other type of organization?

Q106.question_text: How would you place your views on this scale? 1 means you agree completely with the statement on the left; 10 means you agree completely with the statement on the right; and if your views fall somewhere in between, you can choose any number in between.

options.1: Incomes should be made more equal
options.10: There should be greater incentives for individual effort

Q107.question_text: How would you place your views on this scale? 1 means you agree completely with the statement on the left; 10 means you agree completely with the statement on the right; and if your views fall somewhere in between, you can choose any number in between.

options.1: Private ownership of business and industry should be increased
options.10: Government ownership of business and industry should be increased

Q108.question_text: How would you place your views on this scale? 1 means you agree completely with the statement on the left; 10 means you agree completely with the statement on the right; and if your views fall somewhere in between, you can choose any number in between.

options.1: Government should take more responsibility to ensure that everyone is provided for
options.10: People should take more responsibility to provide for themselves

Q109.question_text: How would you place your views on this scale? 1 means you agree completely with the statement on the left; 10 means you agree completely with the statement on the right; and if your views fall somewhere in between, you can choose any number in between.

Q110.question_text: How would you place your views on this scale? 1 means you agree completely with the statement on the left; 10 means you agree completely with the statement on the right; and if your views fall somewhere in between, you can choose any number in between.

options.1: In the long run, hard work usually brings a better life
options.10: Hard work doesn’t generally bring success—it’s more a matter of luck and connections

Q111.question_text: Which of the following comes closer to your view? (1 = Protecting the environment should be given priority, even if it causes slower economic growth and some loss of jobs, 2 = Economic growth and creating jobs should be the top priority, even if the environment suffers to some extent)

options.1: Protecting the environment should be given priority
options.2: Economic growth and creating jobs should be the top priority

Q112.question_text: How would you place your views on corruption in your country? (1 = There is no corruption in my country, 10 = There is abundant corruption in my country)

options.1: There is no corruption in my country
options.10: There is abundant corruption in my country

Q113.question_text: How many state authorities do you believe are involved in corruption?

Q114.question_text: How many business executives do you believe are involved in corruption?

Q115.question_text: How many local authorities do you believe are involved in corruption?

Q116.question_text: How many civil service providers do you believe are involved in corruption?

Q117.question_text: How many journalists and media people do you believe are involved in corruption?

Q118.question_text: We want to know about your experience with local officials and service providers, like police officers, lawyers, doctors, teachers and civil servants in your community. How often do you think ordinary people like yourself or people from your neighbourhood have to pay a bribe, give a gift or do a favor to these people in order to get the services you need? Does it happen never, rarely, frequently or always?

Q119.question_text: Can you tell me how strongly you agree or disagree with the following statement: “on the whole, women are less corrupt than men”?

Q120.question_text: How high is the risk in this country to be held accountable for giving or receiving a bribe, gift or favor in return for public service? To indicate your opinion, use a 10-point scale where “1” means “no risk at all” and “10” means “very high risk”.

Q121.question_text: Now we would like to know your opinion about the people from other countries who come to live in [your country] - the immigrants. How would you evaluate the impact of these people on the development of [your country]?

Q122.question_text: Do you agree that immigration fills important job vacancies?

Q123.question_text: Do you agree that immigration strengthens cultural diversity?

Q124.question_text: Do you agree that immigration increases the crime rate?

Q125.question_text: Do you agree that immigration gives asylum to political refugees who are persecuted elsewhere?

Q126.question_text: Do you agree that immigration increases the risks of terrorism?

Q127.question_text: Do you agree that immigration offers people from poor countries a better living?

Q128.question_text: Do you agree that immigration increases unemployment?

Q129.question_text: Do you agree that immigration leads to social conflict?

Q130.question_text: What should the government do about people from other countries coming here to work?

options.1: Let anyone come who wants to
options.2: Let people come as long as there are jobs available
options.3: Place strict limits on the number of foreigners who can come here
options.4: Prohibit people coming here from other countries

Q131.question_text: How secure do you feel these days?

Q132.question_text: How frequently do robberies occur in your neighborhood?

Q133.question_text: How frequently does alcohol consumption in the streets occur in your neighborhood?

Q134.question_text: How frequently do police or military interfere with people’s private life in your neighborhood?

Q135.question_text: How frequently does racist behavior occur in your neighborhood?

Q136.question_text: How frequently does drug sale occur in the streets of your neighborhood?

Q137.question_text: How frequently does street violence and fights occur in your neighborhood?

Q138.question_text: How frequently does sexual harassment occur in your neighborhood?

Q139.question_text: Have you not carried much money for reasons of security?

Q140.question_text: Have you preferred not to go out at night for reasons of security?

Q141.question_text: Have you carried a knife, gun or other weapon for reasons of security?

Q142.question_text: To what degree are you worried about losing your job or not finding a job?

Q143.question_text: To what degree are you worried about not being able to give your children a good education?

Q144.question_text: Have you been the victim of a crime during the past year?

Q145.question_text: Has someone in your family been the victim of a crime during the past year?

Q146.question_text: To what degree are you worried about a war involving your country?

Q147.question_text: To what degree are you worried about a terrorist attack?

Q148.question_text: To what degree are you worried about a civil war?

Q149.question_text: If you had to choose between freedom and equality, which one would you consider more important?

Q150.question_text: If you had to choose between freedom and security, which one would you consider more important?

Q151.question_text: Of course, we all hope that there will not be another war, but if it were to come to that, would you be willing to fight for your country?

Q152.question_text: Which of the following goals should be the most important for the country over the next ten years?

options.1: A high level of economic growth
options.2: Making sure this country has strong defense forces
options.3: Seeing that people have more say about how things are done at their jobs and in their communities
options.4: Trying to make our cities and countryside more beautiful

Q153.question_text: Which of the following goals should be the second most important for the country over the next ten years?

options.1: A high level of economic growth
options.2: Making sure this country has strong defense forces
options.3: Seeing that people have more say about how things are done at their jobs and in their communities
options.4: Trying to make our cities and countryside more beautiful

Q154.question_text: Which of the following is most important for the country?

options.2: Giving people more say in important government decisions

Q155.question_text: Which of the following is the second most important for the country?

options.2: Giving people more say in important government decisions

Q156.question_text: In your opinion, which of the following is most important?

options.2: Progress toward a less impersonal and more humane society
options.3: Progress toward a society in which ideas count more than money

Q157.question_text: In your opinion, which of the following is the second most important?

options.2: Progress toward a less impersonal and more humane society
options.3: Progress toward a society in which ideas count more than money

Q158.question_text: Science and technology are making our lives healthier, easier, and more comfortable.

Q159.question_text: Because of science and technology, there will be more opportunities for the next generation.

Q160.question_text: We depend too much on science and not enough on faith.

Q161.question_text: One of the bad effects of science is that it breaks down people’s ideas of right and wrong.

Q162.question_text: It is not important for me to know about science in my daily life.

Q163.question_text: All things considered, would you say that the world is better off or worse off because of science and technology?

Q164.question_text: How important is God in your life?

Q166.question_text: Do you believe in life after death?

Q169.question_text: Whenever science and religion conflict, religion is always right.

Q170.question_text: The only acceptable religion is my religion.

Q171.question_text: Apart from weddings and funerals, about how often do you attend religious services these days?

Q172.question_text: Apart from weddings and funerals, about how often do you pray?

Q173.question_text: Independently of whether you attend religious services or not, would you say you are:

Q174.question_text: With which of the following statements do you agree most? The basic meaning of religion is:

options.1: To follow religious norms and ceremonies
options.2: To do good to other people

Q175.question_text: With which of the following statements do you agree most? The basic meaning of religion is:

options.1: To make sense of life after death
options.2: To make sense of life in this world

Q176.question_text: How much do you agree or disagree with the statement that nowadays one often has trouble deciding which moral rules are the right ones to follow?

Q177.question_text: Please tell me whether you think claiming government benefits to which you are not entitled can always be justified, never be justified, or something in between.

Q178.question_text: Please tell me whether you think avoiding a fare on public transport can always be justified, never be justified, or something in between.

Q179.question_text: Please tell me whether you think stealing property can always be justified, never be justified, or something in between.

Q180.question_text: Please tell me whether you think cheating on taxes if you have a chance can always be justified, never be justified, or something in between.

Q181.question_text: Please tell me whether you think someone accepting a bribe in the course of their duties can always be justified, never be justified, or something in between.

Q182.question_text: Please tell me whether you think homosexuality can always be justified, never be justified, or something in between.

Q183.question_text: Please tell me whether you think prostitution can always be justified, never be justified, or something in between.

Q184.question_text: Please tell me whether you think abortion can always be justified, never be justified, or something in between.

Q185.question_text: Please tell me whether you think divorce can always be justified, never be justified, or something in between.

Q186.question_text: Please tell me whether you think sex before marriage can always be justified, never be justified, or something in between.

Q187.question_text: Please tell me whether you think suicide can always be justified, never be justified, or something in between.

Q188.question_text: Please tell me whether you think euthanasia can always be justified, never be justified, or something in between.

Q189.question_text: Please tell me whether you think a man beating his wife can always be justified, never be justified, or something in between.

Q190.question_text: Please tell me whether you think parents beating children can always be justified, never be justified, or something in between.

Q191.question_text: Please tell me whether you think violence against other people can always be justified, never be justified, or something in between.

Q192.question_text: Please tell me whether you think terrorism as a political, ideological or religious mean can always be justified, never be justified, or something in between.

Q193.question_text: Please tell me whether you think having casual sex can always be justified, never be justified, or something in between.

Q194.question_text: Please tell me whether you think political violence can always be justified, never be justified, or something in between.

Q195.question_text: Please tell me whether you think the death penalty can always be justified, never be justified, or something in between.

Q196.question_text: Do you think the government should have the right to keep people under video surveillance in public areas?

options.3: Probably should not have the right
options.4: Definitely should not have the right

Q197.question_text: Do you think the government should have the right to monitor all e-mails and any other information exchanged on the Internet?

options.3: Probably should not have the right
options.4: Definitely should not have the right

Q198.question_text: Do you think the government should have the right to collect information about anyone living in this country without their knowledge?

options.3: Probably should not have the right
options.4: Definitely should not have the right

Q199.question_text: How interested would you say you are in politics?

Q200.question_text: When you get together with your friends, would you say you discuss political matters frequently, occasionally, or never?

Q201.question_text: How often do you obtain information from a daily newspaper?

Q202.question_text: How often do you obtain information from TV news?

Q203.question_text: How often do you obtain information from radio news?

Q204.question_text: How often do you obtain information from your mobile phone?

Q205.question_text: How often do you obtain information from email?

Q206.question_text: How often do you obtain information from the Internet?

Q207.question_text: How often do you obtain information from social media (e.g., Facebook, Twitter)?

Q208.question_text: How often do you obtain information from talking with friends or colleagues?

Q209.question_text: Have you ever signed a petition?

Q210.question_text: Have you ever joined in boycotts?

Q211.question_text: Have you ever attended peaceful demonstrations?

Q214.question_text: Have you ever contacted a government official?

Q215.question_text: Have you ever encouraged others to take action about political issues?

Q216.question_text: Have you ever encouraged others to vote?

Q217.question_text: Have you ever searched for information about politics and political events online?

Q219.question_text: Have you ever encouraged other people to take any form of political action online?

Q220.question_text: Have you ever organized political activities, events, or protests online?

Q221.question_text: When elections take place at the local level, do you vote always, usually, or never?

Q222.question_text: When elections take place at the national level, do you vote always, usually, or never?

Q223.question_text: If there were a national election tomorrow, for which party on this list would you vote? (If DON'T KNOW: Which party appeals to you most?)

Q224.question_text: In your view, how often are votes counted fairly in this country’s elections?

Q225.question_text: In your view, how often are opposition candidates prevented from running in this country’s elections?

Q226.question_text: In your view, how often does TV news favor the governing party in this country’s elections?

Q227.question_text: In your view, how often are voters bribed in this country’s elections?

Q228.question_text: In your view, how often do journalists provide fair coverage of elections in this country?

Q229.question_text: In your view, how often are election officials fair in this country’s elections?

Q230.question_text: In your view, how often do rich people buy elections in this country?

Q231.question_text: In your view, how often are voters threatened with violence at the polls in this country?

Q232.question_text: In your view, how often are voters offered a genuine choice in the elections in this country?

Q233.question_text: In your view, how often do women have equal opportunities to run for public office in this country?

Q234.question_text: How important would you say having honest elections is for you?

SDG1.question_text: How much would you say the political system in your country allows people like you to have a say in what the government does?

Q235.question_text: How do you feel about having a strong leader who does not have to bother with parliament and elections as a way of governing this country?

Q236.question_text: How do you feel about having experts, not government, make decisions according to what they think is best for the country?

Q237.question_text: How do you feel about having the army rule as a way of governing this country?

Q238.question_text: How do you feel about having a democratic political system as a way of governing this country?

Q239.question_text: How do you feel about having a system governed by religious law in which there are no political parties or elections?

Q240.question_text: In political matters, people often talk of 'the left' and 'the right.' How would you place your views on this scale, generally speaking?

Q241.question_text: How essential is it as a characteristic of democracy that governments tax the rich and subsidize the poor?

options.1: Not an essential characteristic of democracy

Q242.question_text: How essential is it as a characteristic of democracy that religious authorities ultimately interpret the laws?

options.1: Not an essential characteristic of democracy

Q243.question_text: How essential is it as a characteristic of democracy that people choose their leaders in free elections?

options.1: Not an essential characteristic of democracy

Q244.question_text: How essential is it as a characteristic of democracy that people receive state aid for unemployment?

options.1: Not an essential characteristic of democracy

Q245.question_text: How essential is it as a characteristic of democracy that the army takes over when government is incompetent?

options.1: Not an essential characteristic of democracy

Q246.question_text: How essential is it as a characteristic of democracy that civil rights protect people from state oppression?

options.1: Not an essential characteristic of democracy

Q247.question_text: How essential is it as a characteristic of democracy that the state makes people’s incomes equal?

options.1: Not an essential characteristic of democracy

Q248.question_text: How essential is it as a characteristic of democracy that people obey their rulers?

options.1: Not an essential characteristic of democracy

Q249.question_text: How essential is it as a characteristic of democracy that women have the same rights as men?

options.1: Not an essential characteristic of democracy

Q250.question_text: How important is it for you to live in a country that is governed democratically?

Q251.question_text: How democratically is this country being governed today?

Q252.question_text: How satisfied are you with how the political system is functioning in your country these days?

Q253.question_text: How much respect is there for individual human rights nowadays in this country?

Q258.question_text: How close do you feel to [continent; e.g., Europe, Asia, etc.]?

Q259.question_text: How close do you feel to the world?

Q260.question_text: Respondent’s sex (Code respondent’s sex by observation, don’t ask about it!)

Q261.question_text: Can you tell me your year of birth, please?

Q262.question_text: This means you are _______ years old (write in age in two digits).

Q263.question_text: Were you born in this country or are you an immigrant to this country?

Q264.question_text: Is your mother an immigrant to this country or not?

Q265.question_text: Is your father an immigrant to this country or not?

Q266.question_text: In which country were you born?

Q267.question_text: In which country was your mother born?

Q268.question_text: In which country was your father born?

Q269.question_text: Are you a citizen of this country?

options.1: Yes, I am a citizen of this country.
options.2: No, I am not a citizen of this country.

Q270.question_text: Including yourself, how many people – including children – live here regularly as members of this household?

Q271.question_text: Do you live with your parents or your parents-in-law?

options.4: Yes, both own parent(s) and parent(s)-in-law

Q272.question_text: What language do you normally speak at home?

Q273.question_text: Are you currently (read out and code one answer only):

Q275.question_text: What is the highest educational level that you have attained?

Q276.question_text: What is the highest educational level that your spouse has attained?

Q277.question_text: What is the highest educational level that your mother has attained?

Q278.question_text: What is the highest educational level that your father has attained?

Q279.question_text: Are you employed now or not? If yes, about how many hours a week? (If more than one job: only for the main job)

options.1: Full time employee (30 hours a week or more)
options.2: Part time employee (less than 30 hours a week)

Q280.question_text: Is your spouse employed? In his/her LAST job was he/she employed (either full time or part time) or was he/she self-employed?

options.1: Full time employee (30 hours a week or more)
options.2: Part time employee (less than 30 hours a week)

Q281.question_text: To which of the following occupational groups do you belong? (Respondent's current or last job, if unemployed)

options.1: Professional and technical (e.g.: doctor, teacher, engineer, artist, accountant, nurse)
options.2: Higher administrative (e.g.: banker, executive in big business, high government official, union official)
options.3: Clerical (e.g.: secretary, clerk, office manager, civil servant, bookkeeper)
options.4: Sales (e.g.: sales manager, shop owner, shop assistant, insurance agent, buyer)
